item.title: ElevenLabs raises $500M from Sequoia at an $11 billion valuation
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: ElevenLabs' valuation has raised more than three times in the last 12 months.

item.title: After backlash, Adobe cancels Adobe Animate shutdown and puts app on ‘maintenance mode’
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Adobe's announcement about discontinuing Animate was met with incredulity, disappointment, and anger. The company has changed its tune.

item.title: Uber appoints new CFO as its AV plans accelerate
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: Krishnamurthy has been at Uber for over six years, spending most of his tenure in the company in its investor relations division.

item.title: SNAK Venture Partners raises $50M fund to back vertical marketplaces
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: The firm has already invested in six companies, including BigRentals and Repackify, focused on equipment rental and packaging logistics, respectively.

item.title: Alexa+, Amazon’s AI assistant, is now available to everyone in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Amazon opens Alexa+ to everyone in the U.S. The AI feature is free for Prime members across devices, and free for everyone on mobile and web.

item.title: Apeiron Labs gets $9.5M to flood the oceans with autonomous underwater robots
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Most of what we know about the ocean just skims the surface, literally. We’ve gathered a large quantity of data on the oceans from satellites, but most of that is based on the top layer of water. Below that, the picture gets murkier. Buoys, ships, and some autonomous rovers have recently added some detail, but […]

item.title: Accel doubles down on Fibr AI as agents turn static websites into one-to-one experiences
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Fibr AI replaces marketing agency– and engineering-heavy website personalization with autonomous systems designed for enterprise scale.

item.title: Spotify upgrades its lyrics feature with offline access, more translations
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Spotify is revamping its lyrics feature, adding offline access for Premium users, global lyric translations, and a more prominent placement in the Now Playing view.

item.title: Exclusive: Positron raises $230M Series B to take on Nvidia’s AI chips
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: The investment comes from backers including the Qatar Investment Authority as demand for chips beyond Nvidia soars and as Qatar aims to build out its AI infrastructure.

item.title: Epstein-linked longevity guru Peter Attia leaves David Protein, and his own startup ‘won’t comment’
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Attia co-founded longevity medical testing startup Biograph, which came out of stealth a year ago.

item.title: India’s Varaha bags $20M to scale carbon removal from the Global South
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Varaha's fresh funding is part of a $45 million Series B round led by WestBridge Capital.

item.title: The Minneapolis tech community holds strong during ‘tense and difficult time’
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Founders and investors in the Minneapolis tech industry told TechCrunch they've put much of their work on hold to help out their community.

item.title: Intel will start making GPUs, a market dominated by Nvidia
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Intel has been bulking up a team to focus on this effort and will develop its GPU strategy around customer needs.

item.title: YC startups can now receive investment in stablecoin
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: All startups accepted into YC will soon have the option to receive their seed checks via stablecoins.

item.title: 2026 plans: What’s next for Startup Battlefield 200
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: See what to expect for Startup Battlefield 200 in 2026, the ultimate startup pitch competition on the global stage at TechCrunch Disrupt. Join the mailing list to be the first to know when applications drop.

item.title: Homeland Security is trying to force tech companies to hand over data about Trump critics
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The use of administrative subpoenas, which are not subject to judicial oversight, are used to demand a wealth of information from tech companies, including the owners of anonymous online accounts documenting ICE operations.

item.title: Skyryse lands another $300M to make flying, even helicopters, simple and safe
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Skyrsye, now valued at $1.15 billion, is pushing to get FAA certification for its universal operating system for flight.

item.title: Xcode moves into agentic coding with deeper OpenAI and Anthropic integrations
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Xcode 26.3 offers agentic coding capabilities with Anthropic's Claude Agent and OpenAI's Codex.

item.title: Gradient’s heat pumps get new smarts to enable old-building retrofits
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Gradient's heat pumps fit in windows, minimizing installation times. Now, it is introducing software to make those units more intelligent.

item.title: Watch Club is producing short video dramas and building a social network around them
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Watch Club will house microdramas and fan discussions in the same app, creating a fandom-focused social media experience.
